page.title: 08Fishing.
page.content: The boats of the Dubh Thob harbour in Bernera go out every day except Sunday if the weather is good. Every year in the summer the fishermen go out fly fishing for mackerel. The fish are caught so that they can be used as lobster bait. Creels made of net covered steel frames are used to fish for lobsters and, in summer, crabs. When the fishermen come in from fishing they land the lobsters on the pier in Bernera. The lobsters are put on a trolley, brought over to the factory, weighed, sent away to Aberdeen then sold again.
